At-a-Glance: Amitraz can be effective, but resistance risk is real. Stewardship means rotation, correct dose, and full-course adherence.
Objectives: Follow label dose and duration exactly.
What Good Looks Like: Full course completed; strips/tabs spaced correctly.
Rotation plan avoids repeated use back-to-back.
Step-by-Step: 1) Count frames of brood/bees to place correct number of strips.
2) Space in brood area; avoid clumping; start timer.
3) Remove on time; dispose safely; verify counts.
4) Record product, lot, dates, and outcomes.
Seasonality & Climate: Use outside honey super periods for market honey.
Data & Thresholds: Label exposure days and strip density per brood area.
Diagnostics & Decision Tree: Low effect -> Placement wrong or resistance rising; switch class.
Brood impacts -> Check spacing and duration; review colony health.
Common Pitfalls: Not spacing strips through the brood nest.
Safety & Compliance: Follow label; remove before supering for sale honey.
Communications: Explain rotation logic to protect future efficacy.
Notes: Keep a visible rotation chart on the truck clipboard.
